attributes.action: instruct the UK Border Agency to release Li Zheng from detention immediately, cease all actions directed toward her deportation, and to grant her the asylum to which she can legitimately lay claim.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Li Zheng is a Chinese national claiming asylum in the UK because she is a member of a group persecuted within her homeland. She could, if deported, face arbitrary detention, torture, or even execution.

As of Friday, 3 July 09, Ms Zheng has again been detained when reporting to the UKBA, as required by the asylum process, and is now facing deportation on Tuesday, 7 July '09.

Li Zheng is, demonstrably, a practitioner of Falun Gong. Evidence shows that practitioners face persecution and human rights abuses by the Chinese authorities (see Facebook group - http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=116696972237&ref=nf - for more details.)

Those who know Ms Zheng personally, or as the mother of Meng Tian, will testify to her impeccable character, and devout religious practice. 

Ms Li Zheng therefore fulfils the UKBA's own (along with the European Convention on Human Rights) criteria for asylum (see Facebook group for details).

We therefore ask that the government acts urgently to grant her the asylum to which she is so clearly entitled.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
